html: (2 Nephi 16:8)."I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send." While there are messianic overtones in both the question of the Lord and in the prophet's response, "Here am I," (compare Abraham 3:27), the direct application is to Isaiah's willingness to serve. His initial, but brief, hesitancy to serve was not based on his lack of faith in God's power, but only because of his own feelings of unworthiness. Once being assured he was cleansed and worthy to serve, he stepped to the forefront. Isaiah's response reminds one of Nephi's declaration regarding a difficult assignment given him. (See 1 Nephi 3:7.)
